remarks:
A natural number is either 0 or a successor.  (Contributed by NM, 27-May-1998.) 

---

 A natural number is either 0 or a successor.  Similar theorems for arbitrary sets or real numbers will not be provable (without the law of the excluded middle), but equality of natural numbers is decidable. (Contributed by NM, 27-May-1998.)
statement:
nn0suc $p |- ( A e. _om -> ( A = (/) \/ E. x e. _om A = suc x ) ) $.
$d A x $.
